Several functions that require an AudioDeviceId will accept this value to signify the app just wants the system to choose a default device instead of the app providing a specific one. Since SDL 3.2.0. DefaultRecording = 4294967294 A value used to request a default recording audio device. Several functions that require an AudioDeviceId will accept this value to signify the app just wants the system to choose a default device instead of the app providing a specific one. Since SDL 3.2.0.

api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.Mixer.Mix_EffectDone.title: Delegate Mixer.Mix_EffectDone_t | SharpSDL3
api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.Mixer.Mix_EffectDone.summary: Delegate Mixer.Mix_EffectDone_t Namespace SharpSDL3.Mixer Assembly SharpSDL3.dll This is a callback that signifies that a channel has finished all its loops and has completed playback. public delegate void Mixer.Mix_EffectDone_t(int chan, nint udata) Parameters chan int The channel number that your effect is affecting. udata nint User Data Remarks This gets called if the buffer plays out normally, or if you call Mix_HaltChannel(), implicitly stop a channel via Mix_AllocateChannels(), or unregister a callback while it's still playing.

api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.Mixer.Mix_EffectFunc.title: Delegate Mixer.Mix_EffectFunc_t | SharpSDL3
api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.Mixer.Mix_EffectFunc.summary: Delegate Mixer.Mix_EffectFunc_t Namespace SharpSDL3.Mixer Assembly SharpSDL3.dll This is the format of a special effect callback: myeffect(int chan, void *stream, int len, void *udata); public delegate void Mixer.Mix_EffectFunc_t(int chan, nint stream, int len, nint udata) Parameters chan int The channel number that your effect is affecting. stream nint The buffer of data to work upon. len int The size of (stream). udata nint User Data Remarks (chan) is the channel number that your effect is affecting. (stream) is the buffer of data to work upon. (len) is the size of (stream), and (udata) is a user-defined bit of data, which you pass as the last arg of Mix_RegisterEffect(), and is passed back unmolested to your callback. Your effect changes the contents of (stream) based on whatever parameters are significant, or just leaves it be, if you prefer. You can do whatever you like to the buffer, though, and it will continue in its changed state down the mixing pipeline, through any other effect functions, then finally to be mixed with the rest of the channels and music for the final output stream.

api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.MusicInterface.html.title: Struct MusicInterface | SharpSDL3
api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.MusicInterface.html.summary: Struct MusicInterface Namespace SharpSDL3.Mixer Assembly SharpSDL3.dll Defines an interface for a music backend in SDL3_mixer, specifying how to load, play, and manage music data. public struct MusicInterface Inherited Members ValueType.Equals(object) ValueType.GetHashCode() ValueType.ToString() object.Equals(object, object) object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks This struct is used internally by SDL3_mixer to interact with different music backends (e.g., MP3, OGG, MIDI). Each field is either a property or a delegate corresponding to a function in the music backend. api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.html.title: Namespace SharpSDL3.Mixer | SharpSDL3
api/SharpSDL3.Mixer.html.summary: Namespace SharpSDL3.Mixer Classes Mixer Structs Chunk The internal format for an audio chunk Music MusicInterface Defines an interface for a music backend in SDL3_mixer, specifying how to load, play, and manage music data. Enums AudioDeviceId Fading The different fading types supported Mixer.MixInit The internal format for a music chunk interpreted via codecs MusicApi MusicMetaTag MusicType These are types of music files (not libraries used to load them) Delegates Mixer.Mix_ChannelFinishedCallback Mixer.Mix_EachSoundFontCallback Mixer.Mix_EffectDone_t This is a callback that signifies that a channel has finished all its loops and has completed playback. Mixer.Mix_EffectFunc_t This is the format of a special effect callback: myeffect(int chan, void *stream, int len, void *udata); Mixer.Mix_MixCallback Mixer.MusicFinishedCallback MusicInterface.CloseDelegate Closes the backend and cleans up resources. MusicInterface.CreateFromFileDelegate Creates a music object from a file, used when SDL_IOStream is not supported. MusicInterface.CreateFromIODelegate Creates a music object from an SDL_IOStream. MusicInterface.DeleteDelegate Deletes a music object, freeing its resources. MusicInterface.DurationDelegate Gets the total duration of the music. MusicInterface.GetAudioDelegate Retrieves audio data from a music object. MusicInterface.GetMetaTagDelegate Retrieves a metadata tag from the music. MusicInterface.GetNumTracksDelegate Gets the number of tracks in the music. MusicInterface.GetVolumeDelegate Gets the volume for a music object. MusicInterface.IsPlayingDelegate Checks if a music object is currently playing. MusicInterface.JumpDelegate Jumps to a specific order in MOD music. MusicInterface.LoadDelegate Loads the backend library. MusicInterface.LoopEndDelegate Gets the loop end position of the music. MusicInterface.LoopLengthDelegate Gets the loop length of the music. MusicInterface.LoopStartDelegate Gets the loop start position of the music. MusicInterface.OpenDelegate Initializes the backend for audio output with the specified audio specification. MusicInterface.PauseDelegate Pauses playback of the music. MusicInterface.PlayDelegate Starts playing a music object from the beginning. MusicInterface.ResumeDelegate Resumes playback of the music. MusicInterface.SeekDelegate Seeks to a specific position in the music. MusicInterface.SetVolumeDelegate Sets the volume for a music object. MusicInterface.StartTrackDelegate Starts playback from a specific track. MusicInterface.StopDelegate Stops playback of the music. MusicInterface.TellDelegate Gets the current playback position of the music. MusicInterface.UnloadDelegate Unloads the backend library.

TTF_PROP_RENDERER_TEXT_ENGINE_RENDERER = "SDL_ttf.renderer_text_engine.create.renderer" Field Value string Methods AddFallbackFont(Font, Font) Add a fallback font public static bool AddFallbackFont(Font font, Font fallback) Parameters font Font The Font to modify. fallback Font The Font to add as a fallback Returns bool Returns true on success or false on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks Add a font that will be used for glyphs that are not in the current font. The fallback font should have the same size and style as the current font. If there are multiple fallback fonts, they are used in the order added. This updates any Font objects using this Font. This function should be called on the thread that created both fonts. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. See Also ClearFallbackFonts(Font) RemoveFallbackFont(Font, Font) AppendTextString(Text, string) Append UTF-8 text to a text object. public static bool AppendTextString(Text text, string str) Parameters text Text The Text to modify. str string The UTF-8 text to insert. Returns bool Returns true on success or false on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks This function may cause the internal text representation to be rebuilt. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. See Also DeleteTextString(Text, int, int) InsertTextString(Text, int, string) SetTextString(Text, string, ulong) AppendTextString(Text, string, ulong) Append UTF-8 text to a text object. public static bool AppendTextString(Text text, string str, ulong length) Parameters text Text The Text to modify. str string The UTF-8 text to insert. length ulong The length of the text, in bytes, or 0 for null terminated text. Returns bool Returns true on success or false on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks This function may cause the internal text representation to be rebuilt. This function should be called on the thread that created both fonts. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Throws if the Text handle is null or 0x0. See Also DeleteTextString(Text, int, int) InsertTextString(Text, int, string) SetTextString(Text, string, ulong) ClearFallbackFonts(Font) Remove all fallback fonts. public static void ClearFallbackFonts(Font font) Parameters font Font The Font to modify. Remarks This updates any Font objects using this Font. This function shold be called on the thread that created the Font This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. See Also AddFallbackFont(Font, Font) RemoveFallbackFont(Font, Font) CloseFont(Font) Dispose of a previously-created Font public static void CloseFont(Font font) Parameters font Font The Font to dispose of. Remarks Call this when done with a Font. This function will free any resources associated with it. It is safe to call this function on null, for example on the result of a failed call to OpenFont(string, float). The Font is not valid after being passed to this function. String pointers from functions that return information on this font, such as GetFontFamilyName(Font) and GetFontStyleName(Font) are no longer valid after this call, as well. This function should not be called while any other thread is using the Font. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. See Also OpenFont(string, float) OpenFontIO(IOStream, bool, float) CopyFont(Font) Create a copy of an existing Font public static Font CopyFont(Font existingFont) Parameters existingFont Font The Font to copy. Returns Font Returns a valid Font, or null on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks The copy will be distinct from the original, but will share the font file and have the same size and style as the original. When done with the returned Font, use CloseFont(Font) to dispose of it. This function should be called on the thread that created the original Font. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0 See Also CloseFont(Font) CreateGPUTextEngine(nint) Create a text engine for drawing text with the SDL GPU API. public static TextEngine CreateGPUTextEngine(nint device) Parameters device nint The SDL_GPUDevice to use for creating textures and drawing text. Returns TextEngine Returns a TextEngine object or null on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks This function should be called on the thread that created the device. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0 Exceptions ArgumentNullException Throws on a null device InvalidOperationException Throws when failed to create a TextEngine. See Also CreateGPUTextEngineWithProperties(int) DestroyGPUTextEngine(nint) GetGPUTextDrawData(nint) CreateGPUTextEngineWithProperties(int) Create a GPU text engine with custom properties. public static nint CreateGPUTextEngineWithProperties(int props) Parameters props int A pointer to a set of properties for the text engine. Returns nint Returns a pointer to the created GPU text engine, or null on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks This function creates a text engine for drawing text with the SDL GPU API, using the specified properties. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. CreateRendererTextEngine(nint) Create a text engine for drawing text with the SDL renderer API. public static TextEngine CreateRendererTextEngine(nint renderer) Parameters renderer nint The SDL_Renderer to use for creating textures and drawing text. Returns TextEngine Returns a TextEngine object or null on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks This function should be called on the thread that created the renderer. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Throws on a null renderer InvalidOperationException Throws when failed to create a TextEngine. CreateRendererTextEngineWithProperties(int) Create a renderer text engine with custom properties. public static TextEngine CreateRendererTextEngineWithProperties(int props) Parameters props int A pointer to a set of properties for the text engine. Returns TextEngine Returns a TextEngine object or null on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks This function creates a text engine for drawing text with the SDL renderer API, using the specified properties. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Throws on a null props InvalidOperationException Throws when failed to create a TextEngine. CreateSurfaceTextEngine() Create a text engine for drawing text to an SDL surface. public static TextEngine CreateSurfaceTextEngine() Returns TextEngine Returns a TextEngine object or null on failure; call GetError() for more information. Remarks This function creates a text engine for drawing text to an SDL surface. This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.
